sentences: Daisy Elitha Peterson Sweeney (May 7, 1920 â€“ August 11, 2017) was a Canadian classical and jazz music and piano teacher, known for having taught many of the most notable figures in Canadian jazz music.
Sweeney was born in Montreal in 1920.
Beyond teaching, she also co-founded the Montreal Black Community Youth Choir (now called the Montreal Jubilation Gospel Choir) with Trevor W. Payne in 1974.
Montreal Mayor Denis Coderre tweeted in August 2017 that he intends for the city to name a street after her.
In 2018, Sweeney was honoured with a community mural on a building in Montreal's Little Burgundy neighbourhood.

In 2018, Sweeney was honoured with a community mural on a building in Montreal's Little Burgundy neighbourhood. The artist, Kevin Ledo, also painted a mural of Leonard Cohen in the city's Plateau neighbourhood.
